item.title: inZoi is Finally Coming to PS5 in 2026
item.content:encoded:
Following a successful early access launch on PC, inZoi’s unique brand of life-sim gameplay is set to arrive on PS5 in 2026. It looks to include upcoming DLC and should be fully optimized for the console.

inZoi was heralded as a rival to The Sims—in case you’ve forgotten, it’s the game that initially let you run over children. With EA’s series into the hundreds of millions in terms of copies sold, there’s a lot of catching up to do. inZoi achieved one million copies sold within its first week.

Numbers have dropped off since, but this is to be expected. A PS5 release could be what inZoi needs to get back into the picture.

Could inZoi Rival The Sims’ Domination?

In a press release, Krafton declared: “inZOI, its immersive life simulation game, will launch on PlayStation 5 in the first half of 2026. The PS5 version will be fully optimized for console, bringing players the same robust gameplay experience featured on PC.”

The port features “All of the key systems and features that define the PC experience, reworked for console controls and performance to ensure a seamless and intuitive gameplay experience.”

Running over children was eventually declared a bug, so don’t expect to do that on PS5. However, the first major DLC expansion is on the way in 2025—Island Getaway. I’d expect this to come with the PS5 launch, but it remains to be seen if it’s free.

Have you played inZoi on PC? Is there any potential at all for it to challenge The Sims, or other life-sim legends like Stardew Valley and Animal Crossing? You know the place to let us know—the Insider Gaming forum.

As always, there’s plenty of news to read at IG: Battlefield 6 already has 600,000 Steam sales and 2.7 million wishlists, Resident Evil: Requiem will have ‘Last of Us’ combat and vehicles, and Borderlands 4 will feature 30 billion guns.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: All Fortnite Shadow Briefings Locations in Chapter 6 Season 4
item.content:encoded:
Chapter 6 Season 4 is well underway in Fortnite, with a bunch of new Weekly Quests to complete, and locating Shadow Briefings is required if you want to net a handy boost for your Battle Pass.

Shadow Briefings are not new in Fortnite, instead being guaranteed in pretty much every chapter and season that features, but the spawn locations can vary. As such, it can be difficult to track them down in times of need.

We’re here to make things easier, however, by pointing you in the direction of all the Shadow Briefings locations in Chapter 6, Season 4. We’ve also included our tips on the best landing spots to help you complete the quest.

Fortnite Shadow Briefings Locations in Chapter 6 Season 4

Shadow Briefings spawn randomly at the start of each game, though they do have set spawns—which we’ve highlighted on the map above.

Given the spawns are random, there are no guaranteed spots where you can secure Shadow Briefings. However, as the map shows, some areas are better than others, with a few potential spawns in close proximity.

The best spots I’ve found are:

  • South of the Burd To Go in the northwest of the map.
  • The Resistance Base in the northeast of the map.
  • O.X.R HQ in the mid-west of the map.

Heading to these locations is a great starting point in your hunt, given the potential spawns nearby. They also offer a decent haul of loot, so you will be well prepared if you encounter enemy players.

It may still take a few matches to tick off the quest entirely, however, but with these locations at your disposal, it won’t take too much time to knock out. You can also revisit the same spot if you enter a different match.

How to Find & Accept Shadow Briefings in Fortnite

As you approach a Shadow Briefing spawn in Fortnite, a white laptop will appear on your map marking the location.

To complete the weekly quest, follow these steps:

  1. Head to one of the locations on the map above to find a Shadow Briefing.
  2. Approach the briefcase and interact with it to accept a mission.
  3. Complete this step three times to tick off the Weekly Quest.

As the Weekly Quest only tells you to find and accept Shadow Briefings, you don’t need to complete the missions they provide. However, if you do, you can net yourself some decent loot and some additional experience.

Are you enjoying Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 4 so far? What would you like to see added? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Fortnite, read Arrowhead’s assessment of the Helldivers comparisons, and check out claims that proximity chat is coming to Battle Royale.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Already Has Over 600k Steam Sales and 2.7m Wishlists
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6 already boasts over 600,000 pre-order sales on Steam and has a whopping wishlist total of 2.7m, according to new data.

The EA title is undoubtedly one of the most anticipated games of the year, with over half a million players jumping in during the first Open Beta weekend. The Battlefield 6 Open Beta returns this weekend and could hit similar numbers, with a new map and modes being added.

While Open Beta numbers don’t necessarily guarantee success, it appears the stars are aligning for EA with Battlefield 6 as the pre-order sales and wishlists on Steam suggest the community is ready to purchase.

Battlefield 6’s Eye-Watering Pre-Order Data

According to data from Alinea Analytics, over 600,000 pre-orders have been placed for Battlefield 6 on Steam, while a whopping 2.7m players have added the title to their Steam wishlist.

The data adds that this translates to revenues of around $35m on Steam alone, with Battlefield 6 sitting at number two last week for revenues on Steam and number three for totalsales. Of course, this only equates to one platform, too.

Battlefield’s 6 impressive numbers have been rising for a while, however, taking just a few days to surge past the 500,000 wishlist mark when the game was added to Steam last month, including a staggering period from July 25 to 30 with between 95,000 and 150,000 players adding the game to their wishlists each day.

Those numbers put Battlefield 6 in sixth position in Steam’s top wishlisted games, behind only Hollow Knight: Silksong, Subnautica 2, Deadlock, Borderlands 4, Light No Fire, and ARC Raiders.

Have you pre-ordered Battlefield 6 yet? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum!

For more Battlefield 6, check out details on the matchmaking, and take a look at our impressions from the Battlefield 6 beta.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Grounded 2 Surpasses 3 Million Player Mark
item.content:encoded:
Grounded 2 has surged past the three million player mark just a few weeks into its early access lifespan, it has been revealed.

The Obsidian Games title, a sequel to the initial game that was fully released in September 2022, has capitalized on the popularity of the franchise to set impressive numbers.

Most impressive, however, is that this is still extremely early on in Grounded 2’s lifespan, with a full release not officially set and plenty to come in the roadmap, so the signs are certainly promising.

Grounded 2’s Impressive Numbers

Posting on X (formerly Twitter), Microsoft’s vice president of games marketing, Aaron Greenberg, revealed the latest numbers from Grounded 2, with over three million jumping in.

These numbers cover only those on Xbox Series X|S and PC, via Steam or the Xbox App, with Grounded 2 yet to be released on any other platforms, like PlayStation 5 and Nintendo Switch 2.

That means there is still ample opportunity for further boosts to the Grounded 2 player base, especially when you factor in updates including new tools, rideable bugs, and bosses.

Grounded 2 has already massively surpassed the original title on Steam, with a concurrent record of just shy of 50,000 set after launch, per SteamDB. In comparison, the highest concurrent player peak for the initial title is just over 32,000, set in 2021.

All in all, it’s very encouraging signs for the future of Grounded 2 and the franchise overall, with plenty more surges expected in the future.

Have you dived into Grounded 2 yet? What do you make of the game? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more news, check out how a Marvel Rivals’ PS4 version could be on the cards, and read about Crimson Desert’s delay until 2026.

item.title: All Roblox Forge a Weapon Codes & Rewards—Every August 2025 Active Code
item.content:encoded:
Forge a Weapon lets Roblox players become a medieval blacksmith and perfect the art of crafting. Here is everything you need to know about using reward codes in the game.

Forge a Weapon in Roblox lets players put their blacksmithing skills to the test. But as precious metals are hard to come by, reward codes make it much easier, offering a steady stream of gold.

Below, we’ll reveal every active reward code in the game, and we’ll also keep track of all of the expired codes so you can always stay on top of your smithing workload.

Every Active Roblox Forge a Weapon Code & Reward (August 2025)

Below, you can find all of the active codes in Roblox Forge a Weapon for August 2025.

Use these codes as quickly as they’ll eventually expire, never to be cast in iron again:

How to Redeem Roblox Forge a Weapon Codes

To redeem codes in Roblox Forge a Weapon codes, just follow these easy steps:

  1. Launch the Roblox Forge Mastergame.
  2. Click on the chat box, on the left side of the screen.
  3. Now, click the ‘Insert Code’ option.
  4. Type in the code you want, and press ‘Redeem’.

If the code is still active, then you’ll receive the reward. Codes, like precious minerals and can only be used once per user account.

All Expired Roblox Forge a Weapon Codes

As of August 2025, we can confirm that the codes listed below have all expired.

Sometimes, Roblox codes will come back into use, depending on the code. So it’s often worth giving them a try, even if they’ve expired. You never know if it will work again.

Where to Find Roblox Forge a Weapon Codes

Be sure to bookmark this page if you want to always know which codes are active. That’s because we update when new codes come in.

However, new codes tend to arrive first on the game’s official Discord server. So signing up for that is a smart way to be among the first to have the codes.

Do you love forging games in Roblox? Then be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can start up some fun new discussions about the best games.

While you’re at it, check out our code guides for other forging games, such as Forge Master, Triangulate, and Prospecting.

item.title: All Roblox Supermarket Simulator Codes & Rewards—Every August 2025 Active Code
item.content:encoded:
Supermarket Simulator is a grocery gathering game in Roblox. Here is every active and expired code for the game this month.

If you love Roblox but also enjoy a bit of retail therapy, then Supermarket Simulator may be perfect for you. But the game also has its own coupon system in the form of reward codes!

Below, we’ve compiled all the active reward codes for this month to help you secure the best deals. We’ll also keep track of all expired codes, so you never use an out-of-date coupon at the checkout.

Every Active Roblox Supermarket Simulator Code & Reward (August 2025)

Below, you can find all of the active codes for August 2025.

Codes are likely to expire over time, so make sure you use them before they do.

How to Redeem Supermarket Simulator Codes in Roblox

To redeem codes, just follow the steps below:

  1. Launch Roblox and then the Supermarket Simulator game.
  2. Press the Z key to bring up the ‘Codes’ option.
  3. Type in the code you want, and press ‘Redeem’.

If the code is still active, then you’ll receive the reward. Remember, you can only use a code once per user account.

All Expired Roblox Supermarket Simulator Codes

As of August 2025, here are all the expired codes.

Remember, codes sometimes keep working after expiring, so it’s always worth giving them one final try.

Where to Find Roblox Supermarket Simulator Codes

While you’re here, make sure you bookmark this page. That’s because we’ll update it when new codes come in.

Remember, fresh and new codes tend to appear first on the game’s official Discord server. This is another great way to get codes before anyone else.

Be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can start up some fun new discussions about the best games in Roblox.

item.title: Resident Evil: Requiem Will Have ‘Last of Us’ Combat and Vehicles
item.content:encoded:
It was recently confirmed that we’ll be seeing Resident Evil: Requiem gameplay during the Opening Night Live ceremony at Gamescom, set to take place on August 19. Even more recently, notable Resident Evil leaker ‘Dusk Golem’ took to social media to uncover a series of tidbits regarding the next major release in the legendary franchise.

In a series of posts, Dusk Golem claimed that new lighting and shadow engines have been implemented, the AI system is unique and intelligent, and some open-level areas in Raccoon City will require a vehicle to traverse them.

Resident Evil: Requiem to Feature ‘Last of Us Part 2’ Combat

Dusk Golem has been a goldmine for Resident Evil leaks, but it’s always worth prefacing this with the ‘take it with a pinch of salt’ recommendation. Everything is always subject to change.

In a series of posts on social media, Dusk Golem revealed stacks about the upcoming Resident Evil: Requiem, all of which could be confirmed or refuted next week when gameplay is shown during Opening Night Live.

Right now officially they’ve talked about as you mentioned the ability to switch between first & third person on the fly (& basically designing two different games alongside each other to accomplish this as require big retooling to work with both), the new lighting/shadow engine, hair engine from Pragmata.

Additionally we know the stalker uses a new dynamic AI system they’ve done to behave uniquely & intelligently on the fly. There’s few other innovations, some I know, but also sure I don’t know all of them.

A small handful I don’t mindsharing is they’ve been working hard to achieve having good performance on open-level designed areas like Raccoon City, along w/a vehicle to travel around it. The combat with Leon has seen huge innovations, honestly some Last of Us Part 2-isms, but also its own innovations.

There’s been effort to provide more environmental physic systems and interactivity for Grace’s segments where she has to work with the environment more, & balance light & darkness. And more I won’t say, & sure more I don’t know. But they have a lot more to reveal.

Dusk Golem later shared an image of Alice from the Resident Evil movie series riding a motorcycle ‘without any context’, suggesting that we’ll be using a similar mode of transport in Resident Evil: Requiem.

Do these leaks gel with what you’re expecting from Resident Evil: Requiem? Let me know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Crimson Desert has been delayed to 2026

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Crimson Desert Delayed to 2026 Due to ‘Longer Than Expected Timelines’
item.content:encoded:
It has been announced that Crimson Desert, the upcoming open-world action title from Pearl Abyss, has been pushed back to Q1 2026. This news was announced during a recent earnings call and accompanied by a clear explanation.

The team at Pearl Abyss emphasized that the plans to showcase Crimson Desert at Gamescom will remain unchanged. Next week, the game’s open-world build will be rendered playable at Gamescom for the first time, and in September, the same demo will be available to explore at the Tokyo Game Show.

‘Unavoidably Delayed’

Talking on the delay of Crimson Desert during a recent earnings conference call, the Pearl Abyss team said:

Currently, Crimson Desert has been in the process of voice-overs, while also carrying out tasks such as console certification in preparation for its release. In the case of marketing, we plan to participate in Gamescom and PAX West this August to showcase our open-world build. And in September, we will join the Tokyo Game Show to strengthen our marketing efforts in the Japanese market.

The launch of Crimson Desert, our first large-scale AAA console game, has been unavoidably delayed by one quarter, from the previously announced schedule. This is due to longer than expected timelines arising from schedule coordination and collaborations with multiple partners for offline distribution, voice-overs, console certification, and other launch preparations.

We sincerely apologize for not being able to meet the originally promised fourth quarter launch schedule. Please kindly understand that this is a strategic decision aimed at insuring success on a meaningful scale.

(Thanks to Gematsu for the quote)

It was then stated that Crimson Desert has been given an ‘internally confirmed’ release window of Q1 2026. There will be a follow-up announcement in due course, unveiling a firmer launch date. It was stressed that Crimson Desert’s release date will not be revealed at Gamescom.

Are you disappointed to hear about this delay? Let me know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Borderlands 4 will feature 30 billion guns
